suspended,19790822,NYC17,protest $this game actually ended 3 times; Jeffrey Leonard flied out to CF to end game and Mets left field; however, SS Frank Taveras had asked for time before the pitch to Leonard and it was granted by 3B umpire Doug Harvey; the Mets were called back on the field and Leonard singled to CF; however, manager Mets manager Joe Torre noted that first baseman Ed Kranepool was not on the field and argued that the game could not properly resume without 9 defenders; the umpires agreed and brought Leonard back to HP; Houston manager Bill Virdon argued that the count on Leonard should revert to 0-0 and erase the pitches thrown while Kranepool was absent; the umpires ruled that the pitches would count; Virdon formally protested the game; Leonard then flied out to LF to apparently end the game a second time; NL President Chub Feeney was at the game and one hour later upheld the Houston protest, saying that Leonard's single was legal; the game was resumed the next evening with Leonard on first with his single and a new pitcher for the Mets, who faced one batter and the game was finally ended
